discourse_list.title: Dai below 8 billion supply - Update DAI below 7 Billion Supply

content.content: image1920×897 90.9 KB  Currently, the bear market is hitting hard on DAI circulation, Vaults repayment, higher PSM burn and yet we still have a high TLV. It would have been a tremendous opportunity to use the USDC we had in the PSM to get positive returns on DEFI protocols and to further secure the protocol.   image1920×897 93.8 KB  :c
Saludiego_201:  It would have been a tremendous opportunity to use the USDC we had in the PSM to get positive returns on DEFI protocols and to further secure the protocol.   It still is
I think the majority of makers agree with that, I think the majority here at maker want that. A governance survey and a serious and serious plan of proposals that is born fast.
I don’t know if I’m right but it seems they want to use the usdc to invest in bonds, let’s really hope they come to a quick conclusion on this.
It’s not too late until it’s too late

@Saludiego_201 , if you like doing this type of analyses maybe reach out to @Davidutro / @Artem_Gordon / @twblack88 as they’re doing weekly analyses on the state of the Peg, Dai supply, L2s, and more.

I don’t know how I can help these cracks at analysis, but I would be happy to help in any way I can, I regularly like to review the onchain data and look at the distribution of tenure on a day by day basis to see where it would be best to invest on a personal basis. I will keep my eyes open.
If you’re in discord, we do open calls while assembling state of dai every week. Mondays at 11am PST.

@Saludiego_201 Yes, feel free to jump in 7PM UTC into the Relay and State of Dai Discord    Discord   Discord - A New Way to Chat with Friends & Communities Discord is the easiest way to communicate over voice, video, and text.  Chat, hang out, and stay close with your friends and communities.

If they are going the TradFi route might as well go for the cream of the crop in terms of collateral which is life insurance. The virtues of life insurance are that it hedges mortality risk, goes up when the stock market goes up, it does not go down when the market goes down, rising interest rates increase future returns from higher-yielding Treasuries, it is Tier-1 capital on bank balance sheets, and it is highly efficient to liquidate. There is a land grab for this asset from many shadow banks and regional banks: CVLOCs.pdf - Google Drive For more information on whole life insurance see my previous post: New Collateral: Whole Life Insurance For more information on Indexed universal Life see my google doc: Insurance As An Asset Class - Google Slides
Your solution is quite interesting, especially because in times of crisis they go up, it could be a good backup. Everyone should look at it now with a broader view.

I would strongly urge the community to go in this direction. It is a win-win-win scenario in that MakerDAO benefits from onboarding an uncorrelated lifelong stream of income; the insured building equity tax-free with the benefit of no liquidation leverage; and, the insurance company onboarding a massive influx of premium-paying customers to buy more bonds and invest in more index options and thereby benefit by earning a larger spread. Upon expiration, the outstanding loan is paid in full and the remainder is inherited by the insured beneficiaries. It makes sense financially and makes for great publicity.

Institutional Vaults and RWA are step by step taking a good part inside Maker. In a bear market is hard for people to maintain Vaults. But is a great opportunity for people to stack for the next bull run. Also lets please not forget L2s, Maker has been not available for retail to use since quite long time right now, so when we have the Maker Protocol on top of whatever L2 or L1 for sure Dai’s supply will blow ;D
Dai seems to be soon below 7 billion supply but a big chunk of the loss is from USDC PSM which means it’s from decrease in demand for Dai. We should be cautious of it

Doo_StableLab:  Dai seems to be soon below 7 billion supply but a big chunk of the loss is from USDC PSM which means it’s from decrease in demand for Dai. We should be cautious of it   Well, correct me if I am wrong, but if our USDC bag is reduced, this means  that people are swapping DAI for USDC. which in turn means that (in terms of market forces) DAI is worth more than USDC, or in another terms, there is upward pressure on the peg. This means that there is a lot of demand for DAI.   Is the above reasonable? In reality (2) might also just mean that people are scared of decentralised stables, after LUNA/UST, and are moving out to centralised ones.

iammeeoh:  which in turn means that (in terms of market forces) DAI is worth more than USDC, or in another terms, there is upward pressure on the peg. This means that there is a lot of demand for DAI.   Isn’t this backwards? People are exchanging DAI for USDC because demand for DAI is low, probably as a consequence of farming rewards drying up. If DAI was worth more than USDC, you wouldn’t want to use the PSM to exchange DAI for USDC 1:1, as you could get more USDC from a DEX for the equivalent amount of DAI.
Patrick_J:  Isn’t this backwards?   yup! I blundered!    Thanks!

Lozadaluis12:  Also lets please not forget L2s, Maker has been not available for retail to use since quite long time right now, so when we have the Maker Protocol on top of whatever L2 or L1 for sure Dai’s supply will blow ;D   We urgently need to capture that audience from L2 and other alternative networks, the greater usability of Dai is there.
